metadata.title: CVE-2023-0767 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
An attacker could construct a PKCS 12 cert bundle in such a way that couldallow for arbitrary memory writes via PKCS 12 Safe Bag attributes beingmishandled. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 110, Thunderbird < 102.8,and Firefox ESR < 102.8.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-0767` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss3 - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.5+esm12
libnss3-1d - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.5+esm12
libnss3-nssdb - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.5+esm12
libnss3-tools - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.5+esm12
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
nss package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.5+esm12').
